instructions: Three problems: 1. Hospital (Birth of boys > 60% in hospital with 45 vs 15 births); 2. Word Length (Mean length 6 in page vs line); 3. Median Heights (Median of 3 men vs 1 man > 5'11").

items.question: A certain town is served by two hospitals (Larger: 45 births/day; Smaller: 15 births/day). Over a year, which hospital recorded more days on which more than 60% of the babies born were boys?
options: About the same (within 5% of each other)

items.question: An investigator computes average word-length for every page (large sample); another for the first line of every page (small sample). The book average is 4. Which investigator recorded a larger number of units with an average word-length of 6 or more?
Team A checks 3 men a day and records the median height. Team B checks 1 man a day. Which team counted more days where the height was more than 5'11"?
